competencyText.en-us: Grade 6-8
Construction
Demonstrate an understanding of the construction career pathway.
Define and use proper terminology associated with the construction career pathway.
Describe some of the careers available in the construction career pathway.
Identify common characteristics of the careers in the construction career pathway.
Research the history of the construction career pathway and describe how the careers have evolved and impacted society.
Identify skills required to successfully enter a career in the construction career pathway.
Describe technologies associated in careers within the construction career pathway.
Investigate careers and entry requirements within the construction pathway.

Describe careers in the construction career pathway (e.g. managers - project managers, project engineers, estimators, superintendents; sub-contractors and tradespersons - carpenters, masons, electricians, plumbers, HVAC technicians; etc.).
Explain educational and training pathways available for careers in the construction career pathway.
Research and present information on a career in the construction career pathway including roles and responsibilities, opportunities for employment and the requirements for education and training.
Plan the construction of a model or architectural detail from a set of plans.
Calculate material quantities and costs.
Determine the critical path as a progression of construction activities.
Draw a bar chart depicting construction schedule.
Construct a model or architectural detail from plans and specifications.
Use appropriate tools while demonstrating safe work practices.
Apply proper cutting and fastening techniques for basic model materials.
Design/Pre-Construction
Demonstrate an understanding of the design/pre-construction career pathway.
Define and use proper terminology associated with the design/pre-construction career pathway.
Describe some of the careers available in the design/pre-construction career pathway.
Identify common characteristics of the careers in the design/pre-construction career pathway.
Research the history of the design/pre-construction career pathway and describe how the associated careers have evolved and impacted society.
Identify skills required to successfully enter any career in the design/pre-construction career pathway.
Describe technologies associated in careers within the design/pre-construction career pathway.
Investigate careers and entry requirements within the design/pre-construction career pathway.
Describe careers in the design/pre-construction career pathway (e.g. architects, interior designers, drafters, engineers - civil, MEP and structural, urban and regional planners, etc.).
Explain educational and training pathways necessary for careers in the design/pre-construction career pathway.

Research and present information on a career in the design/pre-construction career pathway including roles and responsibilities, opportunities for employment and the requirements for education and training.
Draw basic plans by hand.
Draw plans and corresponding elevations, sections and details.
Apply appropriate architectural scales to drawings.
Apply basic building codes in drawings.
Create door, window and finish schedules.
Supplemental
Identify and explore careers in the Architecture & Construction cluster.
Identify the pathways in the Architecture & Construction career cluster and the careers in each pathway.
Describe the types of places that employ individuals who have careers in the Architecture & Construction career cluster.
Describe the variety of tasks performed by individuals who have careers in the Architecture & Construction career cluster.
List the skills, abilities, and talents needed for careers in the Architecture & Construction career cluster.
Identify the level of training and education required for careers in the Architecture & Construction career cluster.
Research a career in the Architecture & Construction career cluster and present findings to the class.
Apply math, science, and reading skills in the completion of a project or activity related to the Architecture & Construction career cluster.
Read and interpret basic construction documents and specifications.
Name various types of drawings used in construction documents and explain their purpose.
Locate sections, elevations and details indicated on the floor plan within the set of construction documents.
Select and use appropriate architectural scales for various drawings.
Identify various symbols and terminology used in construction documents.
Read and interpret specifications.
Explain the scope and purpose of building codes and regulations.
Read civil, architectural and mechanical, electrical and plumbing (MEP) drawings.
Locate civil plans within a construction documents set, identify defining features and state the importance of these plans.
Locate architectural plans within a construction documents set, identify defining features and state the importance of these plans.
Locate mechanical plans within a construction documents set, identify defining features and state the importance of these plans.
Locate electrical plans within a construction documents set, identify defining features and state the importance of these plans.
Locate plumbing plans within a construction documents set, identify defining features and state the importance of these plans.
Name types of careers associated with the development of civil, architectural and mechanical, electrical and plumbing (MEP) drawings.
Explain sustainability issues related to the design, construction and maintenance of the built environment.
Describe the impact of the construction industry on the natural environment.
Identify sustainable alternatives to conventional practices.
Identify specific practices that can lessen adverse impacts on the environment.
Maintenance/Operations
Demonstrate an understanding of the maintenance/operations career pathway.
Define and use proper terminology associated with the maintenance/operations career pathway.
Describe some of the careers available in the maintenance/operations career pathway.
Identify common characteristics of the careers in the maintenance/operations career pathway.
Research the history of the maintenance/operations career pathway and describe how the careers have evolved and impacted society.
Identify skills required to successfully enter a career in the maintenance/operations career pathway.
Describe technologies associated in careers within the maintenance/operations career pathway.
Investigate careers and entry requirements within the maintenance/operations career pathway.

Describe careers in the maintenance/operations career pathway (energy auditors; building inspectors; system installers - HVAC, telecommunications, security/fire, solar, etc.; maintenance technicians; hazardous materials removers; environmental engineers).
Explain educational and training pathways necessary for careers in the maintenance/operations career pathway.

Research and present information on a career in the maintenance/operations career pathway including roles and responsibilities, opportunities for employment and the requirements for education and training.
Analyze the impact of design decisions on building operations and maintenance.
Compare life-cycle costs for various building materials and/or systems within the built environment.
Explain maintenance procedures for specific products or materials.
